report.summary: Exclude third party tracking when using self-hosted accounts
report.label: None yet
report.description: If I'm signed in to the app using a WordPress.com account, there is a certain expectation that tracking and analytics services might well be tracking my behaviour when using the app. If I'm only signed in to the app using a self-hosted account, I absolutely do not expect tracking or analytics services to be tracking my behaviour. In fact, I was surprised to see data being sent to api.mixpanel.com and reports.crashlytics.com despite only being signed in to the app with my self-hosted account. Not only that, but the data being sent to api.mixpanel.com is obfuscated, so it's not possible to tell what data is being sent without hunting through the source code of the app and figuring it out. Communication with third party tracking services should not happen while you're using a self-hosted account. The app is called "WordPress for Android", not "WordPress.com for Android". I do not expect tracking data to be sent to third party services while I am not using WordPress.com.

report.summary: Creating notes without an account can result in losing notes
report.label: None yet
report.description: When you first open the Android app after downloading it there's an option at the bottom of the screen to "just try the app". This will let users create notes without signing into, or creating, an account. If they later create a new account in the app the notes are copied into it. However if they sign into an existing account, the notes that were created offline will appear on the device but they never appear in the same account when signing in through a web browser. If the user then signs out of their account on the device and signs back in again, all those "local notes" are lost. I think it might be better to remove the option to create notes without an account, or at the very least, provide a warning that signing into an account will result in notes being lost. I hope this makes sense!

report.summary: Revisit how we follow sites/tags in the Reader
report.label: None yet
report.description: "Reader -> Settings -> Enter URL edit text" feature, currently the code to follow a site does: a GET request on read/feed, to fetch for information (or check validity?) a POST request on read/following/mine/new read/feed must be given an exact url or id, there is no discovery. So the first call could lead to an error if the url passed is not exact. We could either drop the first call (depending what we need to fetch/check before following) and only use read/following/mine/new (that does discovery) or do a GET on read/feed/find (that does discovery) instead of read/feed. cc @nbradbury

report.label: None yet
